summary: This bill, S. 2207, amends the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to reform the tax treatment of digital assets. Key provisions include defining digital assets and actively traded digital assets, establishing a de minimis exception for gains/losses from digital asset transactions, clarifying tax treatment of digital asset lending, addressing wash sales of specified assets, allowing mark-to-market elections for dealers/traders in specified assets, deferring income recognition for digital asset mining/staking, and modifying rules for charitable contributions involving digital assets. These changes apply to transactions and tax years starting after specific dates.
